00031 // =================================================================================================
00032 
00033 // =================================================================================================
00034 // Basic types and constants
00035 // =========================
00036 
00037 // The XMP_... types are used on the off chance that the ..._t types present a problem. In that
00038 // case only the declarations of the XMP_... types needs to change, not all of the uses. These
00039 // types are used where fixed sizes are required in order to have a known ABI for a DLL build.
00040 
00041 #if XMP_MacBuild | XMP_iOSBuild
00042 
00043     typedef int8_t   XMP_Int8;
00044     typedef int16_t  XMP_Int16;
00045     typedef int32_t  XMP_Int32;
00046     typedef int64_t  XMP_Int64;
00047 
00048     typedef uint8_t  XMP_Uns8;
00049     typedef uint16_t XMP_Uns16;
00050     typedef uint32_t XMP_Uns32;
00051     typedef uint64_t XMP_Uns64;
00052 
00053 #elif XMP_WinBuild
00054 
00055     typedef signed char XMP_Int8;
00056     typedef signed short XMP_Int16;
00057     typedef signed long XMP_Int32;
00058     typedef signed long long XMP_Int64;
00059 
00060     typedef unsigned char XMP_Uns8;
00061     typedef unsigned short XMP_Uns16;
00062     typedef unsigned long XMP_Uns32;
00063     typedef unsigned long long XMP_Uns64;
00064 
00065 #elif XMP_UNIXBuild
00066 
00067     #if ! XMP_64
00068 
00069         typedef signed char XMP_Int8;
00070         typedef signed short XMP_Int16;
00071         typedef signed long XMP_Int32;
00072         typedef signed long long XMP_Int64;
00073 
00074         typedef unsigned char XMP_Uns8;
00075         typedef unsigned short XMP_Uns16;
00076         typedef unsigned long XMP_Uns32;
00077         typedef unsigned long long XMP_Uns64;
00078 
00079     #else
00080 
00081         typedef signed char XMP_Int8;
00082         typedef signed short XMP_Int16;
00083         typedef signed int XMP_Int32;
00084         typedef signed long long XMP_Int64;
00085 
00086         typedef unsigned char XMP_Uns8;
00087         typedef unsigned short XMP_Uns16;
00088         typedef unsigned int XMP_Uns32;
00089         typedef unsigned long long XMP_Uns64;
00090 
00091     #endif
00092 
00093 #else
00094 
00095     #error "XMP environment error - must define one of XMP_MacBuild, XMP_WinBuild, XMP_UNIXBuild or XMP_iOSBuild"
00096 
00097 #endif
00098 
00099 typedef XMP_Uns8 XMP_Bool;
00100 
00101 const XMP_Uns8 kXMP_Bool_False = 0;
00102 
00103 #define ConvertXMP_BoolToBool(a) (a) != kXMP_Bool_False
00104 #define ConvertBoolToXMP_Bool(a) (a) ? !kXMP_Bool_False : kXMP_Bool_False
00105 
00106 static const XMP_Uns8 Min_XMP_Uns8      = ( (XMP_Uns8) 0x00 );
00107 static const XMP_Uns8 Max_XMP_Uns8      = ( (XMP_Uns8) 0xFF );
00108 static const XMP_Uns16 Min_XMP_Uns16    = ( (XMP_Uns16) 0x00 );
00109 static const XMP_Uns16 Max_XMP_Uns16    = ( (XMP_Uns16) 0xFFFF );
00110 static const XMP_Uns32 Min_XMP_Uns32    = ( (XMP_Uns32) 0x00 );
00111 static const XMP_Uns32 Max_XMP_Uns32    = ( (XMP_Uns32) 0xFFFFFFFF );
00112 static const XMP_Uns64 Min_XMP_Uns64    = ( (XMP_Uns64) 0x00 );
00113 static const XMP_Uns64 Max_XMP_Uns64    = ( (XMP_Uns64) 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFLL );
00114 
00115 static const XMP_Int8 Min_XMP_Int8      = ( (XMP_Int8) 0x80 );
00116 static const XMP_Int8 Max_XMP_Int8      = ( (XMP_Int8) 0x7F );
00117 static const XMP_Int16 Min_XMP_Int16    = ( (XMP_Int16) 0x8000 );
00118 static const XMP_Int16 Max_XMP_Int16    = ( (XMP_Int16) 0x7FFF );
00119 static const XMP_Int32 Min_XMP_Int32    = ( (XMP_Int32) 0x80000000 );
00120 static const XMP_Int32 Max_XMP_Int32    = ( (XMP_Int32) 0x7FFFFFFF );
00121 static const XMP_Int64 Min_XMP_Int64    = ( (XMP_Int64) 0x8000000000000000LL );
00122 static const XMP_Int64 Max_XMP_Int64    = ( (XMP_Int64) 0x7FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFLL );

00219 struct XMP_DateTime {
00220 
00222     XMP_Int32 year;
00223 
00225     XMP_Int32 month;
00226 
00228     XMP_Int32 day;
00229 
00231     XMP_Int32 hour;
00232 
00234     XMP_Int32 minute;
00235 
00237     XMP_Int32 second;
00238 
00240     XMP_Bool hasDate;
00241 
00243     XMP_Bool hasTime;
00244 
00246     XMP_Bool hasTimeZone;
00247 
00250     XMP_Int8 tzSign;
00251 
00253     XMP_Int32 tzHour;
00254 
00256     XMP_Int32 tzMinute;
00257 
00259     XMP_Int32 nanoSecond;
00260 
00261     #if __cplusplus
00262         XMP_DateTime() : year(0), month(0), day(0), hour(0), minute(0), second(0),
00263                          hasDate(false),hasTime(false), hasTimeZone(false), tzSign(0), tzHour(0), tzMinute(0), nanoSecond(0){};
00264     #endif
00265 
00266 };

00275     kXMP_TimeEastOfUTC = +1

00278 #define XMPDateTime_IsDateOnly(dt) ((dt).hasDate & (! (dt).hasTime))
00279 #define XMPDateTime_IsTimeOnly(dt) ((dt).hasTime & (! (dt).hasDate))
00280 
00281 #define XMPDateTime_ClearTimeZone(dt) { (dt).hasTimeZone = (dt).tzSign = (dt).tzHour = (dt).tzMinute = 0; }

00460 #define kXMP_NoOptions          ((XMP_OptionBits)0UL)
00461 
00494 
00495 #define XMP_SetOption(var,opt)      var |= (opt)
00496 #define XMP_ClearOption(var,opt)    var &= ~(opt)
00497 #define XMP_TestOption(var,opt)     (((var) & (opt)) != 0)
00498 #define XMP_OptionIsSet(var,opt)    (((var) & (opt)) != 0)
00499 #define XMP_OptionIsClear(var,opt)  (((var) & (opt)) == 0)
00500 
00553 
00554 #define XMP_PropIsSimple(opt)       (((opt) & kXMP_PropCompositeMask) == 0)
00555 #define XMP_PropIsStruct(opt)       (((opt) & kXMP_PropValueIsStruct) != 0)
00556 #define XMP_PropIsArray(opt)        (((opt) & kXMP_PropValueIsArray) != 0)
00557 
00558 #define XMP_ArrayIsUnordered(opt)   (((opt) & kXMP_PropArrayIsOrdered) == 0)
00559 #define XMP_ArrayIsOrdered(opt)     (((opt) & kXMP_PropArrayIsOrdered) != 0)
00560 #define XMP_ArrayIsAlternate(opt)   (((opt) & kXMP_PropArrayIsAlternate) != 0)
00561 #define XMP_ArrayIsAltText(opt)     (((opt) & kXMP_PropArrayIsAltText) != 0)
00562 
00563 #define XMP_PropHasQualifiers(opt)  (((opt) & kXMP_PropHasQualifiers) != 0)
00564 #define XMP_PropIsQualifier(opt)    (((opt) & kXMP_PropIsQualifier) != 0)
00565 #define XMP_PropHasLang(opt)        (((opt) & kXMP_PropHasLang) != 0)
00566 
00567 #define XMP_NodeIsSchema(opt)       (((opt) & kXMP_SchemaNode) != 0)

00583 
00588     kXMP_PropIsQualifier      = 0x00000020UL,
00589 
00591     kXMP_PropHasLang          = 0x00000040UL,
00592 
00594     kXMP_PropHasType          = 0x00000080UL,
00595 
00596     // --------------------------------------------
00597     // Options relating to the data structure form.
00598 
00600     kXMP_PropValueIsStruct    = 0x00000100UL,
00601 
00604     kXMP_PropValueIsArray     = 0x00000200UL,
00605 
00607     kXMP_PropArrayIsUnordered = kXMP_PropValueIsArray,
00608 
00610     kXMP_PropArrayIsOrdered   = 0x00000400UL,
00611 
00613     kXMP_PropArrayIsAlternate = 0x00000800UL,
00614 
00615     // ------------------------------------
00616     // Additional struct and array options.
00617 
00620     kXMP_PropArrayIsAltText   = 0x00001000UL,
00621 
00622     // kXMP_InsertBeforeItem  = 0x00004000UL,  ! Used by SetXyz functions.
00623     // kXMP_InsertAfterItem   = 0x00008000UL,  ! Used by SetXyz functions.
00624 
00625     // ----------------------------
00626     // Other miscellaneous options.
00627 
00630     kXMP_PropIsAlias          = 0x00010000UL,
00631 
00634     kXMP_PropHasAliases       = 0x00020000UL,
00635 
00637     kXMP_PropIsInternal       = 0x00040000UL,
00638 
00640     kXMP_PropIsStable         = 0x00100000UL,
00641 
00643     kXMP_PropIsDerived        = 0x00200000UL,
00644 
00645     // kXMPUtil_AllowCommas   = 0x10000000UL,  ! Used by TXMPUtils::CatenateArrayItems and ::SeparateArrayItems.
00646     // kXMP_DeleteExisting    = 0x20000000UL,  ! Used by TXMPMeta::SetXyz functions to delete any pre-existing property.
00647     // kXMP_SchemaNode        = 0x80000000UL,  ! Returned by iterators - #define to avoid warnings
00648 
00649     // ------------------------------
00650     // Masks that are multiple flags.
00651 
00653     kXMP_PropArrayFormMask    = kXMP_PropValueIsArray | kXMP_PropArrayIsOrdered | kXMP_PropArrayIsAlternate | kXMP_PropArrayIsAltText,
00654

00864 
00866 enum {
00867 
00868     // ! Hex used to avoid gcc warnings. Leave the constants so the text reads big endian. There
00869     // ! seems to be no decent way on UNIX to determine the target endianness at compile time.
00870     // ! Forcing it on the client isn't acceptable.
00871 
00872     // --------------------
00873     // Public file formats.
00874 
00876     kXMP_PDFFile             = 0x50444620UL,
00878     kXMP_PostScriptFile      = 0x50532020UL,
00880     kXMP_EPSFile             = 0x45505320UL,
00881 
00883     kXMP_JPEGFile            = 0x4A504547UL,
00885     kXMP_JPEG2KFile          = 0x4A505820UL,
00887     kXMP_TIFFFile            = 0x54494646UL,
00889     kXMP_GIFFile             = 0x47494620UL,
00891     kXMP_PNGFile             = 0x504E4720UL,
00892 
00894     kXMP_SWFFile             = 0x53574620UL,
00896     kXMP_FLAFile             = 0x464C4120UL,
00898     kXMP_FLVFile             = 0x464C5620UL,
00899 
00901     kXMP_MOVFile             = 0x4D4F5620UL,
00903     kXMP_AVIFile             = 0x41564920UL,
00905     kXMP_CINFile             = 0x43494E20UL,

00985 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00986 
00988 enum {
00989     kXMP_CharLittleEndianMask = 1,
00990     kXMP_Char16BitMask        = 2,
00991     kXMP_Char32BitMask        = 4
00992 };
00993 
00995 enum {
00997     kXMP_Char8Bit        = 0,
00999     kXMP_Char16BitBig    = kXMP_Char16BitMask,
01001     kXMP_Char16BitLittle = kXMP_Char16BitMask | kXMP_CharLittleEndianMask,
01003     kXMP_Char32BitBig    = kXMP_Char32BitMask,
01005     kXMP_Char32BitLittle = kXMP_Char32BitMask | kXMP_CharLittleEndianMask,
01007     kXMP_CharUnknown     = 1
01008 };
01009 
01042 
01043 #define XMP_CharFormIs16Bit(f)         ( ((int)(f) & kXMP_Char16BitMask) != 0 )
01044 #define XMP_CharFormIs32Bit(f)         ( ((int)(f) & kXMP_Char32BitMask) != 0 )
01045 #define XMP_CharFormIsBigEndian(f)     ( ((int)(f) & kXMP_CharLittleEndianMask) == 0 )
01046 #define XMP_CharFormIsLittleEndian(f)  ( ((int)(f) & kXMP_CharLittleEndianMask) != 0 )
01047 #define XMP_GetCharSize(f)             ( ((int)(f)&6) == 0 ? 1 : (int)(f)&6 )
01048 #define XMP_CharToSerializeForm(cf)    ( (XMP_OptionBits)(cf) )
01049 #define XMP_CharFromSerializeForm(sf)  ( (XMP_Uns8)(sf) )
01050 
01053 #define kXMPFiles_UnknownOffset ((XMP_Int64)-1)
01054 
01057 #define kXMPFiles_UnknownLength ((XMP_Int32)-1)
01058 
01060 struct XMP_PacketInfo {
01061 
01063     XMP_Int64 offset;
01065     XMP_Int32 length;
01067     XMP_Int32 padSize;   // Zero if unknown.
01068 
01070     XMP_Uns8  charForm;
01072     XMP_Bool  writeable;
01074     XMP_Bool  hasWrapper;
01075 
01077     XMP_Uns8  pad;
01078 
01080     XMP_PacketInfo() : offset(kXMPFiles_UnknownOffset), length(kXMPFiles_UnknownLength),
01081                        padSize(0), charForm(0), writeable(0), hasWrapper(0), pad(0) {};
01082 
01083 };
01084

01088     kXMP_PacketInfoVersion = 3
01089 };

01305 class XMP_Error {
01306 public:
01307 
01314     XMP_Error ( XMP_Int32 _id, XMP_StringPtr _errMsg ) : id(_id), errMsg(_errMsg), notified(false) {};
01315 
01317     inline XMP_Int32     GetID() const     { return id; };
01318 
01320     inline XMP_StringPtr GetErrMsg() const { return errMsg; };
01321 
01323     inline XMP_Bool      IsNotified() const { return notified; }
01324 
01326     inline void          SetNotified() { notified = true; };
01327 
01328 private:
01330     XMP_Int32     id;
01333     XMP_StringPtr errMsg;
01335     XMP_Bool notified;
01336 };
